dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazhydromet has just issued an air pollution warning for Almaty and a few other cities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazhydromet has just issued an air pollution warning for Almaty and a few other cities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet has issued an air pollution warning for residents of Almaty and several other cities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, specifically for May 5th, right? That's this coming Monday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, specifically for May fifth, right? That's this coming Monday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 5, 2025, unfavorable meteorological conditions for air pollution are expected in the cities of Zhezkazgan, Aktobe, Almaty, and at night in Atyrau, the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They're expecting what they call 'unfavorable meteorological conditions' in places like Zhezkazgan, Aktobe, Almaty…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They're expecting what they call 'unfavorable meteorological conditions' in places like Zhezkazgan, Aktobe, Almaty...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 5, 2025, unfavorable meteorological conditions for air pollution are expected in the cities of Zhezkazgan, Aktobe, Almaty, and at night in Atyrau, the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Atyrau at night, I saw that. So what does that actually mean, like, in simple terms?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Atyrau at night, I saw that. So what does that actually mean, like, in simple terms?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 5, 2025, unfavorable meteorological conditions for air pollution are expected in the cities of Zhezkazgan, Aktobe, Almaty, and at night in Atyrau, the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's basically when the weather traps pollution close to the ground. Things like calm winds, fog, and this thing called an inversion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's basically when the weather traps pollution close to the ground. Things like calm winds, fog, and this thing called an inversion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfavorable meteorological conditions refer to a combination of short-term weather factors"such as calm, light winds, fog, and temperature inversion"that contribute to the accumulation of harmful pollutants in the lower atmosphere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: A temperature inversion—that's when warm air sits on top of cold air, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A temperature inversion-that's when warm air sits on top of cold air, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A temperature inversion is a weather phenomenon in which warm air sits above a layer of cold air, effectively trapping it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. Normally, warm air rises and takes pollution with it, but during an inversion, everything just… stays put.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. Normally, warm air rises and takes pollution with it, but during an inversion, everything just... stays put.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under normal conditions, warmer air near the ground rises and disperses pollutants. However, during an inversion, the cooler air remains locked near the surface along with emissions, dust, and smoke.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So all the emissions, dust, smoke—it all gets stuck near where people are breathing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So all the emissions, dust, smoke-it all gets stuck near where people are breathing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, during an inversion, the cooler air remains locked near the surface along with emissions, dust, and smoke. As a result, pollution builds up near the ground"especially in urban areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially in cities, yeah. And for Almaty on that day, they're predicting partly cloudy skies, no rain, light northwest winds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially in cities, yeah. And for Almaty on that day, they're predicting partly cloudy skies, no rain, light northwest winds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On May 5, Almaty will see partly cloudy skies with no precipitation. Northwest winds are expected at 3"8 m/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And temperatures up to 30 degrees Celsius. Which, you know, fits with their earlier forecast about May being a degree warmer than usual across Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And temperatures up to thirty degrees Celsius. Which, you know, fits with their earlier forecast about May being a degree warmer than usual across Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Daytime temperatures will range from +28 to +30ÂC. Earlier, Kazhydromet provided a weather forecast for May, stating that average temperatures across most of Kazakhstan are expected to be one degree above the norm.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's one of those days where the weather seems nice but the air quality might be pretty rough.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's one of those days where the weather seems nice but the air quality might be pretty rough.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely something for residents in those areas to keep an eye on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely something for residents in those areas to keep an eye on.
